folder: 34th Street & East River Drive, Manhattan, NY
text:
E. 34th Street, at the East River, showing the locale of the old Borden Avenue (Greenpoint) Ferry. This service, discontinued for several years, was in its last stages restricted to vehicular traffic. The photographer is viewing generally northward from the dock at 33rd Street and shows the New York Steam Co. plant and the Department of Sanitation dock (35th Street), for a background; the tenements are on the north side of 34th Street and extend to First Avenue.

About 1938
Views: 1-2-3-4

Gift of Committee on Housing
Charity Organization Society

folder: 34th Street (East) & East River Drive, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) East 34th Street, at the East River. Shown is the abandoned L.I.R.R. Ferry Terminus with the derelict "Mount Hood" in the slip.

April 8, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The "Mount Hood".

April 8, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: 34th Street (East) & East River Drive, Manhattan, NY
text:
East 34th Street, north side, from the East River (right) to First Avenue, showing details of the easterly terminus of this crosstown thoroughfare. The photographer is viewing northwestward towards the skyscraper outline at 42nd Street, where the graceful Chrysler Bldg. and the utilitarian News Bldg. appear. These are observed across the cleared site at the rivers edge. The New York Steam Co. plant on the right magin is at the foot of 35th Street.

April 11, 1940
Sept. 19, 1939

P. L. Sperr
